bibl.title: Reconsidering the Origin and the Acquisition of P. Lond. Lit. 133.

series.title: Recherches et Rencontres. Publications de la Faculté des Lettres de Genève.

bibl.note: The papyri bought from Henry Stobart. - Papers and documents concerning the acquisition. - The journey of Henry Stobart. - The recto of P. Lond. Lit. 133: P. Lond. I, 98 (p. 126). - P. Lond. Lit. 133 [P. lit. Lond. 133 (= M.-P.3 1236; LDAB 2424)]. - The authenticity of the "Stobart papyri" in the British Museum: a debate. "Further research will probably cast light on the various problems arising from the study of this papyrus, which is peculiar or even strange in several aspects, also considering that the name of Constantine Simonidis, the well known 19th century forger, appears in its history."

bibl.title: Actes du 26e Congrès international de papyrologie. Genève, 16-21 août 2010.

bibl.seg: Otranto Rosa, Reconsidering the Origin and the Acquisition of P. Lond. Lit. 133.

Paul Schubert (Éd.), Actes du 26e Congrès international de papyrologie. Genève, 16-21 août 2010 = Recherches et Rencontres. Publications de la Faculté des Lettres de Genève. 30 (Genève, 2012) pp. 581-590, 1 tabl.

The papyri bought from Henry Stobart. - Papers and documents concerning the acquisition. - The journey of Henry Stobart. - The recto of P. Lond. Lit. 133: P. Lond. I, 98 (p. 126). - P. Lond. Lit. 133 [P. lit. Lond. 133 (= M.-P.3 1236; LDAB 2424)]. - The authenticity of the "Stobart papyri" in the British Museum: a debate. "Further research will probably cast light on the various problems arising from the study of this papyrus, which is peculiar or even strange in several aspects, also considering that the name of Constantine Simonidis, the well known 19th century forger, appears in its history."
